pages.title: Overview
pages.purpose: Introduce NapPlana.NET, explaining it is a .NET SDK for the NapCat QQ bot framework, its purpose, key features, and high-level architecture

pages.title: Getting Started
pages.purpose: Guide users through initial setup and first bot creation

pages.title: Installation
pages.purpose: Explain how to install NapPlana.NET from NuGet, including prerequisites (NapCat server, .NET 9.0, TouchSocket dependencies)

pages.title: Quick Start Example
pages.purpose: Walk through a complete working example of creating a bot, connecting, and sending a message

pages.title: Configuration
pages.purpose: Detail how to configure bot connection parameters (IP, port, token, connection type)

pages.title: Core Concepts
pages.purpose: Explain the fundamental concepts and patterns used throughout the SDK

pages.title: Bot Lifecycle
pages.purpose: Explain bot creation with BotFactory, initialization, operation, and shutdown phases

pages.title: Connection Types
pages.purpose: Describe the four connection types (WebSocketClient, WebSocketServer, HttpClient, HttpServer) and when to use each

pages.title: Event Handling
pages.purpose: Explain the BotEventHandler system, event types, and how to subscribe to events

pages.title: Request-Response Pattern
pages.purpose: Explain the Echo-based correlation mechanism, ApiHandler, and the polling pattern for asynchronous responses

pages.title: Building Messages
pages.purpose: Guide for constructing messages to send through the bot

pages.title: MessageChainBuilder
pages.purpose: Explain the fluent MessageChainBuilder API for constructing complex multi-part messages

pages.title: Message Types Reference
pages.purpose: Comprehensive reference of all message types (Text, Image, At, Reply, Audio, Video, File, etc.)

pages.title: Text and Mention Messages
pages.purpose: Detail text messages and mention/at messages for tagging users

pages.title: Media Messages
pages.purpose: Explain image, audio/record, video, and file messages with various input formats

pages.title: Structured Messages
pages.purpose: Describe reply, forward, node, JSON, and contact messages for complex interactions

pages.title: Interactive Messages
pages.purpose: Cover music, dice, MFace, and other interactive/fun message types

pages.title: API Reference
pages.purpose: Detailed API documentation for all public classes, methods, and types

pages.title: BotFactory
pages.purpose: Document BotFactory methods for creating and configuring bot instances

pages.title: Bot Operations
pages.purpose: Document NapBot methods including SendGroupMessageAsync, SendPokeAsync, StartAsync, StopAsync

pages.title: API Data Structures
pages.purpose: Document request and response data structures like GroupMessageSend, GroupMessageSendResponseData, PokeMessageSend

pages.title: Enumerations
pages.purpose: Complete reference of all enumerations: EventType, NoticeType, MessageType, ApiActionType, LogLevel, etc.

pages.title: BotEventHandler
pages.purpose: Document the static BotEventHandler class and all available events (OnLogReceived, OnMessageSentGroup, etc.)

pages.title: Advanced Topics
pages.purpose: In-depth coverage of advanced usage patterns and customization

pages.title: Connection Architecture
pages.purpose: Explain ConnectionBase abstraction and how connections are implemented internally

pages.title: WebSocket Plugins
pages.purpose: Explain WebSocketAuthPlugin and WebSocketMessageReceiverPlugin, and how the plugin system works with TouchSocket

pages.title: Response Handling Internals
pages.purpose: Deep dive into ApiHandler, WsGlobalRequest, ActionResponse, and the Echo correlation mechanism

pages.title: TouchSocket Integration
pages.purpose: Explain the dependency on TouchSocket library and how it's used for network communication

pages.title: Development
pages.purpose: Information for contributors and those building from source

pages.title: Building from Source
pages.purpose: Explain how to clone the repository1, restore dependencies, build, and run the example project
